text: Presidential elections were held in the Republic of New Granada in 1857. Following constitutional reforms in 1853, they were the first direct presidential elections in the country. The result was a victory for Mariano Ospina Rodríguez of the Conservative Party.Colombia: Elecciones Presidenciales de 1826 a 1990 Political Database of the Americas ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Party !Votes !% |- |align=left|Mariano Ospina Rodríguez||align=left|Conservative Party||97,407||46.23 |- |align=left|Manuel Murillo Toro||align=left|Liberal Party||80,170||38.05 |- |align=left|Tomás Cipriano de Mosquera||align=left|National Party||33,038||15.68 |- |align=left colspan=2|Other candidates||75||0.04 |- |align=left colspan=2|Total||210,960||100 |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: Political Database of the Americas |} ==References== Category:1857 elections in South America Category:1857 in the Republic of New Granada 1857
title: 1857 Colombian presidential election
